name: the online discussion room
postTitle: Artificial Intelligence in healthcare - what do you think?

comments.content: Have you considered data privacy? AI can pose significant risks to patient data privacy.

replies.content: So can humans. AI itself does not pose a data privacy if it is stored correctly. And information by doctors is 100% stored online via the cloud nowadays anyway so there's no difference.

comments.content: AI can also help monitor patients with devices and any changes in their condition would be noticed fast.

I believe using AI in heath care can be extremely beneficial and a useful tool for the medical professional.  However, it should be used at a tool and not as the "say all end all" solution.  It should be used to backup or confirm the medical professionals point of view.  If not the AIs output should be taken into consideration and then tested by the medical professional.
